Description: Marl pottery vase with pointed base, tapered lower body and convex sides, low neck and out-turned rolled rim (chipped), coated in thick red slip and burnished vertically.
Curator's comments: B176 written on shoulder. Possibly illustrated in W.M.F Petrie and A.C. Mace, Diospolis Parva, London (1901), pl. xviii.38b; Late Ware L38m in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). Also like Polished red ware P98k in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Condition: fair; Exterior surface worn in places, base worn from use.
